conclusion: Identify forces acting on the ball: gravity, tension, and electric force.
The ball is suspended by a string at an angle θ with respect to the vertical.
Resolve tension into vertical and horizontal components.
Set up vertical equilibrium equation: T cos(θ) = mg.
Set up horizontal equilibrium equation: T sin(θ) = qE.
Solve for T using vertical equilibrium: T = mg / cos(θ).
Substitute T into horizontal equilibrium equation.
Simplify equation to solve for E: E = mg sin(θ) / (q cos(θ)).
Use trigonometric identity to express E: E = mg tan(θ) / q.
Final answer: E = mg tan(θ) / q.
